Sehr Gutes Gameplay, spannende Kämpfe und eine Story die überirdisch gut ist ! 

10 / 10

After finishing Bioshock Infinite in about 10 hours I am glad that I bought it. It is no doubt one of the best games I have ever played, maybe even the best. If you enjoyed the original Bioshock you definately will enjoy this one. I recommend this game to every single person on the planet.

Guter Shooter mit guter Spielmechanik und vor allem guter Story, die nicht so flach ist wie bei anderen Genrevertretern. Ich hab ca. 11 Stunden zum durchspielen der Hauptstory gebraucht. Von mir eine Empfehlung!

Um profeta muito do malvado pintou no pedaço e vai aprontar altas maldades que até Deus duvida. E sobrou para Booker DeWitt, um ex-soldado e agente do governo dos Estados Unidos resgatar uma garota da pesada. E eles vão fazer de tudo para estragar os planos desse vilão do barulho! - Fim da sessão da Tarde - O jogo é espetacular! História marcante e envolvente, trilha sonora caprichada, cenários esplêndidos e um tiroteiro de qualidade. Vale a pena cada centavo!

Completely overhyped

The graphics are nice, that's just about it.

The story wants to be very interesting, but it just bored me.

Gunplay was really bad and repetitive.

No chance to compete with the original Bioshock
I probably burned two to three years off of my life with all the late nights that I spent playing this game... and I'm okay with that.

simplesmente uma OBRA PRIMA ....
sem maiss

One of the worst examples of a dumbed down modern game that is so afraid of the player dying or losing track of where to go that it becomes laughable. A giant arrow telling you exactly where to go with the press of a button, checkpoints that are extremely close to each other and worst of all, enemies you killed before you died remain dead after you reload the latest checkpoint. So if you reload often enough, at some point no enemies will be left and even your grandma can beat the game.

The gunplay is mediocre, as was to be expected from a Bioshock game. Guns lack punch and enemies take too many hits to kill (unless you headshot them). 

The only positive thing about this game is its atmosphere. That’s clearly the one area where they put in the most effort. I’m not a fan of the artstyle that takes this weird middle-ground between realism and comic style and I don’t really like the setting either, but you have to give them at least credit for realizing a setting well and putting in lots of details.

A good game set in a multiverse tangent of the Bioshock universe.

A very good game I would reccomend, even though in my opinion it has little to do with the original Bioshock story - it being mainly a variant multiverse possibility basically.

The only detracting thing I could say easily about it is that it is far too easy to rely only on a small selection of powers and rely mainly on the guns to do the heavy work in it. It makes the gameplay feel shallow without the powers really being able to shine much better than the weapons. 

Despite that, and much like the other Bioshock games it remains rooted well in a very engaging and well done story that is well worth it.
Best Story.
Damn.

I'd call this a must-play. The narrative is sublime, as is the direction. Gameplay wise, the hardest difficulty settings are capable of providing a bit more of a challenge than I feel most recent FPS games have and the companion character adds greatly to the immersion.

My only complaint about the game is how each combat encounter is presented as a sort of small sandbox. Still fun, but by the halfway point your brain will detect that it's a tad awkward. This is the one aspect of the game that I feel could have used a bit of polish, despite not having any great impact on your overall enjoyment of an otherwise wonderful story.

Played through the game for the first time on Hard. Overall a fantastic experience. Absolute must-try if you can get it on sale.

Story & Art: Possibly in the Top 10 best for the past decade. Mind-blowingly amazing.

Gameplay: Average. I played with the Sniper and went for headshots, which was quite fun. There was always a winning strategy for every fight that I was able to figure out without much frustration. However, the gameplay mostly revolved around mass carnage, a little buying weapons and upgrades, and a little scavenging. It's an FPS, although it might've been better as an RPG or Stealth game.

As a teenager, I found the narrative of this game to be really deep. Now that I'm a jaded adult, it's really just lukewarm centrist pandering. The gunplay is good and the graphics hold up, just don't expect any deep or consistent political narrative.

Do it again, but better.
This seems to be the mantra for Bioshock and it's titles. Whether it is under the sea or in the sky, the games seem like the same meal, but with different spices and garnishes.

Bioshock Infinite is no exception. Same protagonist set in a new world they have never been in (Or have they?) and must fight the powers that be, however deranged or drugged up they are. Power yourself up with lightning, wind and fire to fight with more than bullets. There is no downfall to useing just guns through.

The levels are beautiful and the audio pick ups help to flesh out the world it builds as time goes on. Both the game and the extras as masterfully constructed and beautiful.

I'm going to admit this. While the Infinite gameplay is great and I enjoyed it, I was waiting for the DLC, the re-hashing of the first BioShock. Perhaps a bit of nostalgia for how well that game was made and with the advance in graphics the world of Rapture looks more beautiful than ever. I'll write a game review for each of them seperately.

Bioshock Infinite
Breakdown:
Graphics     9/10
Story           7/10
Gameplay   7/10
Reliability   9/10 
Fun             7/10

BioShock Infinite DLC (With added love from BioShock)
Breakdown: 
Graphics     9/10
Story           9/10
Gameplay   9/10
Reliability   9/10 
Fun             10/10

Over view:
More of the same BioShock (Guns, plasmids ect..). if you like that, the get the game. If you want to see Rapture 2.0, then get this game and the DLC. It's worth the price in my eyes.
awsome

Inicio a la bioshock, com cenários e personagens bem caracterizados, gráficos fantásticos, fazendo você tomar conclusões precipitadas sobre a história, meio com muita ação e combates muito bem produzidos, e um final bem complexo, é dessa forma que se monta Bioshock Infinite.

História: Assim como nas versões anteriores, BI tem como personagem principal uma pessoa capaz fisicamente mas que está tão perdida na história quanto você, Booker Dewitt como investigador é contratado por duas pessoas para ir até uma cidade flutuante cujo o nome é Columbia para resgatar uma garota chamada Elisabeth, Columbia foi contruida e é governada por Zachary Comstock, uma espécie de profeta dito como semi-deus em Columbia. A história flue de forma excepcional, Elisabeth mostra ser uma personagem impressionante, os criadores do jogo capricharam muito nela.

Gráficos: São bem feitos, impressionam pela combinação de cores, luz e sombra, ao contrário de Bioshock 1 e 2, nessa versão as cores são vívidas e alegres além de darem um clima de nostalgia.

Combate: os combates são todos em FPS, as armas são bem feitas e possuem cada uma sua própria característica, não há uma evolução na força das armas, o destaque fica para o "gancho de mão", uma arma que parece que tiraram da idade média que permite que você literalmente destrua o inimigo além de auxiliar no transporte pelos trilhos aéreos.

Coisas que eu não gostei: Muito sangue, nada contra jogos sangrentos, mas Bioshock Infinite exagera em muitos momentos, achei isso desnecessário.
A versão do Steam possui alguns bugs de tela, por exemplo, quando a Elisabeth vai oferecer munição as vezes o ícone de munição fica na tela, e só sai quando ela oferece alguma outra coisa.
Também tem alguns bugs no áudio, as vezes o áudio corta no meio do jogo.

Em todo caso, recomendo MUITO que comprem e joguem, vale cada centavo.
Obra maestra desde mi punto de vista. No le veo nada malo. Los graficos son espectaculares la historia te va a dejar sin palabras

Jeu splendide, j'ai vraiment aimé y jouer, de part son immersion totale mais aussi pour son action, son graphisme et son originalité hors du commun.

En effet, je restais perplexe il y a 3 mois à l'idée d'un éventuel opus qui n'aurait pas le même environnement que les deux premiers Bioshock. Eh bien finalement non, l'originalité fait que l'on prend plutôt bien ce changement, voir même mieux que les deux premiers. Car oui, le fait de changer d'un point à un autre (Et de distance titanesque ...) rend tout de suite un étonnement hors du commun. Cet étonnement peut-être exprimé de façon "mauvaise", du fait d'une immersion brutale, mais peut aussi être exprimé d'une façon "superbe", du fait que le changement n'est pas brutal (Etant donné que dans les deux nous sommes dans un environnement inconnu à ce jour dans l'IRL, cela ne gêne pas. Si on avait été dans le premier Bioshock sur la terre ferme, puis que l'on passe dans Columbia, là, y'aurait eu un problème).

Au niveau du gameplay, décidément rien à redire : Les dures années de travail de Ken Levine et son équipe portent leurs fruits. Nous n'avons pas le temps d'un seul répit, que nous devons enchaîner. De cette façon, on ne manque jamais d'objectif, on ne s'ennuie jamais, et on ne trouve pas le moyen de dire "Y'a rien à faire ...".
La fin, que j'ai trouvé titanesque, a un rôle bien particulier dans le gameplay. Si vous avez (ou vous êtes sur le point de le finir) fini le jeu, vous le saurez plus que moi que l'intrigue et le suspens sont de tailles en fin. Rien à redire ...
En ce qui concerne le type de transport, l'armement, et ce domaine là, rien non plus à redire. Le fait est qu'un nouveau type de transport apparaisse ne m'a pas plus choqué que ça. Mais quand j'ai entendu parlé des Skylines, je me suis dit un peu "Oula, bazard à gogo". Eh bien non. Irrational Games a travaillé lourdement dessus pour en faire un outil d'armement mais aussi un moyen de transport rapide, complexe mais simple d'utilisation, tout en laissant le joueur apprécier la vue. Ce type d'invention est tout simplement révolutionnaire, puisqu'il n'a jamais été inventé auparavant. Un atout donc de taille pour la note du jeu, forcément (Dur de se taper tout à pied quand même !).
Pour l'armement, le fait de switcher d'arme (Les ramasser) est un bon concept. Cela ne nous impose pas particulièrement d'arme, et l'on peut même choisir facilement quand les utiliser. Les armes sont d'un nombre exceptionnels, encore que, mais surtout intéressantes pour leur fonctionnement et leurs qualités propres à chacune.

En ce qui concerne la ville en elle-même, le choix du thème de la RI (Révolution industrielle) en mode futuristique est un choix de taille. On aurait pu penser que le mélange des deux ne s'effectuaient que très mal ... En fait non. Très simple à assimiler, la ville regorge de coins à explorer, en plus des Skylines, avec des engins et bâtiments à droite à gauche à explorer, donc vraiment gigantesque.
De plus, des affiches et réclames sont toujours présentes, ce qui ne changera pas, cela donne un goût assez naturel à la ville, comme si ça avait toujours été comme ça.

Les personnages, dont Elizabeth, ont été très bien pensés. Le fait d'incarner un ancien détective qui a des dettes à rembourser n'est pas forcément plaisant, mais l'objectif lui l'est. Si on avait incarné ce personnage dans un objectif différent, ça aurait complètement tout chamboulé ... Et ce jeu n'aurait pas fait fort. Pourquoi ? Car les personnages ont l'air réels, ils parlent, leurs gestes sont fluides et sont des gestes de tous les jours, leurs réactions sont naturelles, ce ne sont pas des robots qui font "Oh, tu te fais attaquer, défonce le Songbird".
Le partenaire est souvent là pour vous aider, sans vous gêner, et vous accompagne dans vos missions tout au long du jeu, ce qui est un point positif.

Si je devais dire ne serait-ce qu'un mot pour décrire ce jeu, je pense que ce serait le suivant : Phénoménal.
Tout ce que j'ai dis avant, n'est que le fruit de ce mot. En fait, Bioshock Infinite, c'est un univers encore jamais conquis, inexploré, mais ce vide vient d'être comblé par un incroyable opus qui restera gravé dans bien des mémoires, et sera un illustre du jeu vidéo.
Une petite phrase maintenant pour le décrire : Phénomène et révolution du jeu vidéo, à thème plus qu'incroyable et histoire plus qu'immersive.

Voilà voilà, je vous recommande ce jeu !

Não me sinto realmente confiante para fazer um review desse jogo, sabendo que não irei conseguir expressar tudo que senti jogando ele. Começa tudo muito lindo em Columbia, você se apaixona pelos gráficos e pela cidade ser tão pacifica e bonita. Diferentemente do primeiro Bioshock onde somos colocados em uma cidade já em colapso com splicers tomando conta e tudo está decaindo. Após algum tempo de gameplay já percebemos que Columbia não é tão pacifica quanto parece (já era de se esperar), porém todos os personagens continuam maravilhosos e com uma personalidade marcante. Particularmente, gostei muito da mudança que temos do Bioshock para o Bioshock Infinite no que se diz ao personagem principal, é muito mais fácil se apegar ao Booker do que ao Jack. Levando em consideração que no Bioshock o Jack é totalmente algo em branco para o jogador, não demonstra nenhum pensamento e não responde a nada. 
Gostei muito do gameplay do BI, era de se esperar que tentassem diferenciar o estilo do jogo dos outros dois anteriores, e acho que continou muito bom. A trilha sonora continua incrivel como os outros jogos da franquia, toca até Queen em um momento de tortura!! Achei o jogo principal um tanto curto, mas dá para entender a história completamente com o que apresentam. As DLCs Burial At Sea são realmente muito boas, principalmente o episode 2, jogar com a Elizabeth sempre foi algo que desejei desde o inicio do jogo principal. Todas as referências feitas no burial at sea em relação ao Bioshock me fizeram ficar arrepiada! 
Para finalizar, recomendo totalmente esse jogo e espero que todos se apaixonem por essa obra prima assim como eu.

The game is very enjoyable and tells a great story. Some say that the combat gets repetitive and boring, however, I don't find this to be true, I find it to be quite enjoyable actually. The storyline thus far is great and sometimes it can be hard to stop playing. That being said sometimes it IS hard to stop playing because of the lack of manual saves, forcing you to either replay the last ~15 minutes or to continue on to the next autosave. However, like I said the game is very fun, mostly due to Elizabeth. Without her, I feel, the game would lack depth and wouldn't be as intersting by a long shot. In most games followers tend to get in the way or are just plain annoying. However, Elizabeth is quite useful. She can find you ammo, money, and salts that can definitely help during combat. Along with her excellent voice acting and wonderful personality, she makes for a great follower. Overall this game is very enjoyable, it has a great storyline, great characters, the combat is quite fun, and above all Elizabeth is just wonderful to have as a companion. I highly recommend this game even at it's full price.

100/10

Игра BioShock Infinite не связана сюжетно с предыдущими играми серии Bioshock, но содержит ряд схожих с ними тем и образов. Её действие происходит в 1912 году в вымышленном летающем городе Колумбия. Главный герой, частный детектив Букер ДеВитт, проникает в город в поисках девушки по имени Элизабет. Позже Букер и Элизабет оказываются в центре войны между властями города и мятежными рабочими. Благодаря сверхъестественной способности Элизабет создавать «разрывы» между параллельными мирами герои раскрывают мрачные секреты города и своего собственного прошлого.

Bioshock Infinite is a warm welcom to the Bishock franchise. It totally makes up for Bioshock 2 and if you dont belive me play it yourself. It feels so good to jump off a rail and break someones neck. The game is full of twists and turns here and there so be warned. Anywhey this game is totally worth the $40.00 price tag however many fans may disapointed that this installment features no Big Daddys.

One of the best games i've ever played in my life. It has one of the most complicated endingfs i've seen in a game and the whole thing feels really bioshocky. Buy this thing, for the love of Comstock buy the game.

Bioshock Infinite is a singleplayer First Person Shooter in which the player takes on the role of Booker DeWitt, a former Pinkerton who is sent to Colombia, a city in the sky, to rescue/kidnap a girl in order to eliminate a debt which he owes. It is the third Bioshock game, and hits on many of the same thematic notes, exploring a specific type of political ideology - specifically theocracy, in this case.

The combat follows the improvements which came in Bioshock 2, allowing you to gun with one hand and fire special magical abilities, called Vigors, with the other. Unfortunately, the combat can be a little haphazard at times, as there are a number of enemies that end up being little more than bullet sponges and can take the player character out rapidly - this is only exacerbated on higher difficulties. That being said, I enjoyed the game more than enough to play through multiple times on multiple difficulties.

The soundtrack and plot of this game are its crowning achievements. The character of Elizabeth is one of the best realized and acting characters in video game history. There's many layers and hints to the story scattered throughout which greatly reward successive playthroughs.

The graphical style is bright and vibrant and works VERY well for the tone they are attempting to convey. The voice acting is top-notch. This is easily one of the best first person shooters ever released, and I cannot recommend it enough.

A spectacular and perfectly refined FPS, set in a gorgeous world.
The third chapter of BioShock series relies much more on FPS mechanics than his predecessors, while narration is still at first place. However, unlike the first two chapters, storytelling is rather messy and characters are less vivid, provoking a little detachment of the player. The brand new world is still amazingly described, rich and with a magnificent graphic impact, giving life to a true atmosphere. As always, artistic choices are brilliant. For example I particularly enjoyed mozart’s requiem matching some plot revelations and a nocturne by chopin coming out of a gramophone, which well suits the picture of the slums. BioShock Infinite establishes a point of reference for modern first-person shooters.

Море красок,динамичные бои,множество вариаций боя. Проще сказать игра шикарная,прошел несколько раз,и пока не разочаровался единственное что могу подметить это не очень веселый,и едва понятный конец. И еще один минус последние локаций не сбалансированы,вы вероятно останетесь без патронов) А в целом игра стоит того чтоб ее пройти,и не один раз.

И так, пожалуй я не являюсь фанатом серии Биошок, и, когда друзья предлагали мне новенькую часть Биошока я как-то не брал это в голову (проще говоря- игнорировал), ведь на мой взгляд цена завышена. Просматривая трейлеры я не нашел в этой игре нечего интересного. Но в канун Нового Года стим порадовал всех своими скидками, и я увидев эту игру со скидкой чуть ли не в 90% решился на ее покупку. И вот кинув деньги на счет стим я покупаю новенький Биошок, после установки я долгое время настраивал графику (ведь мягко говоря, пк мой не очень). 
По прибытию в Колумбию я был удивлен на сколько все красочно и проработано до мелочей, я обошел каждый уголок начальной Колумбии и нередко засматривался на статую в которой живет та самая Элизабет. Вскоре мне надоедает бегать одному, но в какой-то момент мы попадаем к ней. В момент наблюдения за Элизабет она меня удивляет, впервые вижу такого живого персонажа, мимика лица чего только стоит. И вот мы особождаем ее. В момент когда мы лежим без сознания она услышав музыку бежит в то место от куда она играет, вскоре мы находим ее танцующей, она предлагает потанцевать и нам, но у Букера задание... 
В последующем прохождении игры Элизабет будет снабжать нас солями(маной), здоровьем и др. Во время прохождения я нередко смотрел на неё, как она себя ведёт и тп. В конце концов по мере прохождения все встает на свои места, почему у нее нет фаланга на 1м из пальцев руки и тп. От концовки игры я ожидал большего, я надеялся что будут хотя бы 2 варианта концовок, но нет, создатели посчитали что одного будет достаточно. И так обобщим персонаж выдался очень живым и довольно симпотичным, часто помогает нам в боях. Про других персонажей сказать нечего не могу, ведь по моему в игре главную роль играет Элизабет, а не Букер. 
 Плюсы игры:
-Красочные локации
-Очаровательный, запутанный и интригующий сюжет
-Элизабет выглядит словно живой человек
-Музыкальный подход
 Минусы игры:
-Быстропроходимая
-Концовка
 В заключении скажу, что игра стоит своих денег и потраченного времени на ее прохождение. Вскоре думаю о приобретении ДЛЦ. Моя оценка 10/10

Bioshock Infinite is a great game, has an awesome story, awesome graphics and awesome gameplay 10/10
Found my new favorite game no question. Thats all there needs to be said, but the ending left me feeling like a son of a bitch

After several years and several friends recommending the BioShock series I finally caved...

Positives

Graphics:
+The BioShock games have a distinct art style and Infinite is no different.  Don't expect hyper realistic character models, as they tend to be a little more stylized.  That being said, they fit perfectly into the environment (Columbia) perfectly.  The city of Columbia itself is gorgeous, easily lending itself to exploration.  The detail put into even into the small details is impressive and really helps the city feel real.  I spent extra time in each locale in the game just to look at the different pictures/statues/houses that inhabited the area.  

Story:
+Infinite has a very immersive story.  The original BioShock has an excellent environment which was the driving reason for me to finish the game.  Infinite also has a great environment, but I was more interested in what was going to happen next rather that just exploring.  The audio clip backstories make a return as voxophone recordings.  I've always loved these as they really add depth to the game and flesh out what is happening in the story.  The pacing in the game is good and you always have a clear goal.  Needless to say there are several interesting twists and turns in the plot, and the ending is excellent.  I won't go any further.  

Audio:
+All of the BioShock games do a good job here but I feel that Infinite sets a high bar.  I'm a sucker for oldies and classical and Infinite really scratched that itch.  Overall they do an excellent job of setting the atmosphere.  

Gameplay:
+This is probably the most refined BioShock game as far as mechanics are concerned.  Shooting is crisp and clean in comparison to the first two titles.  I appreciate the diverse set of guns you are given to work with.  Almost all powers given to you in the game are actually useful.  However, probably the biggest improvement is the addition of a NPC as a partner.  Elizabeth really makes this game.  Her presence feels natural and really adds depth.  I'll be honest, you really grow attached to her.  


Negatives

-Maybe I just like my games to be very difficult....but this one felt overly easy.  I played through on Hard mode and didn't come to a single section that was too taxing.  I have yet to play the 1999 mode, but based off of how the death system works, I don't see it being too huge of a challenge.  This has been a common complaint of mine throughout the BioShock series.  
-I wish that you could carry more than two weapons.  Obviously not a deal breaker, and more realistic in this setting, but having to pick two weapons when there are so many awesome ones was painful.  In their defense, they did an excellent job of placing weapons throughout the game so they were easy to find and readily available (i.e. come to a wide open area and.....oh snap, there is a sniper rifle over there! Just in time!)
-I also wish there was a different way to upgrade weapons.  Being able to buy weapon upgrades took a huge element out of the fun of exploration for me.  In the first two BioShock games, I scoured the levels to make sure that I could power all my guns up.  Being able to buy them instead took this fun away.  



Anywho, thats probably long enough.  Overall 10/10; would play again, would suggest again, would watch someone else play again.
probably the best first person shooter game Ive played. i highly recommend it to anyone. love this game

the world is great, the story is even better, were this a movie it'd be one of the best of the decade, however this is a game and there's one more piece to meention: Gameplay. This is wheere the game flops hard. As an fps it is crucial that the gunplay is satisfying, however, thee weapons are uninspired and lack any recoil opting insteend for a widening reticle (a sign of a console focused game) on harder difficulties the enemied can take more than one magizine from your weapons to kill (neever mind that theeir snipers onee shot you with the accuracy of  robocop) and it dosent stop there, you get into areas that havee too many enemies, combinees with your low damagee and theeir accuracy, you can die before you leearn wheere the enemies are.

honestly it gets to the point where you grow tired of thee combat so much that you lower the difficulty just to make it end faster. but as a story, this game is exceelleent

Rating 9/10
Overview: First Person Shooter


The Good:

+ As is the case with every Bioshock game proceeding this one, the world, setting and atmosphere is the main attraction and this game is no different. The city of Columbia is beautiful and one of the most interesting and unique game settings to play in. 

+ Graphically both artistically and technically this game is gorgeous. Easily one of the best looking games on PC to date. 

+ The story is fantastic dealing with major themes such as racism, morality, religion and faith. A game that should leave a lasting impression on you long after you finish it. 

+ Elizabeth one of the main NPC's is incredibly helpful in and out of combat, providing you with health, ammo, money etc. The developers did a great job making her realistic and helpful and not a hindrance.  

+ The game introduces vigors (identical to plasmids from previous Bioshock games) that give you special powers such as charging enemies, shocking, possessing etc that give you an advantage in combat.

+ Plenty of weapons/vigors to fit your play style. You can charge in and blast your enemies with shotguns or stay back and snipe with a sniper rifle. 

+ The game introduces skylines for you to ride on adding an extra gameplay element to combat. You can jump on and off the the skylines at will to either attack enemies from above or to escape a potentially dangerous situation. 

+The three pieces of DLC are very enjoyable. Clashes in the Clouds is a horde mode across 4 levels and 15 waves each. The goal obviously is to survive each wave and if possible complete the bonus objective. Burial at Sea part 1 and 2 tie in the story of Infinite with the events of the first game. Although the story may be a bit contrived in doing so it was still nice to revisit Rapture from a different point of view. Each episode introduces some new gameplay elements. The first episode being more action oriented while the second being more stealth oriented. 

+ Great music and sound

Average

- Other than the inclusion of skylines the gunplay introduces nothing new. You can also only carry 2 weapons at one time which feels very limiting compared to the previous games. 

- Throughout the game you will find pieces of equipment for you to wear. You can equip a total of 4 pieces. The problem is the vast majority of equipment you find is terrible and offers little to no value. The few that are good can really break the game. There is no balance. 


-The last gameplay segment is uninspiring. I got the feeling the developers ran out of time/creative ideas.

Conclusion

You really have to love the world, story and characters to really appreciate this game. If you play it solely for the gameplay you may find yourself a tad disappointed. I personally loved the game I only wish the world was more open ended for me to explore at my own pace.
